NewsLine.NewsLineText: WORLD-HIGHLIGHTS 1400 GMT:Reuters World News Highlights 1400 GMT Sept 23

body.p: BERLIN - Germany faced the prospect of continued economic stagnation after Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder won Sunday's election with a reduced majority that narrowed his scope to implement painful reforms.
Schroeder said a minister who enraged Washington by allegedly linking U.S. President George W. Bush to Hitler would step aside, but repeated his opposition to war against Iraq.
LONDON - Britain said a draft U.N. Security Council resolution on Iraq would be tabled within days and would make it clear to Saddam Hussein that he must honour previous commitments and disarm.
RAMALLAH, West Bank - Israeli and Palestinian officials held their first talks since the army imposed a siege on Yasser Arafat's West Bank headquarters, but failed to end the four-day-old standoff.

YAMOUSSOUKRO - French troops sent to help Westerners trapped by a bloody military uprising set up camp on the road to Ivory Coast's second city, where dozens of American children are among foreigners in hiding.
The uprising has plunged the West African country into its worst crisis since independence from France in 1960.

SRINAGAR, India - Militants launched a string of attacks on security forces and political workers in Indian Kashmir as violence flared on the eve of a second round of a state assembly election, police said. Twelve people were wounded and four rebels killed in separate incidents.
MERIDA, Mexico - Hurricane Isidore plowed across Mexico's Yucatan peninsula, forcing thousands from their homes as it flooded streets, toppled trees and power lines and shut down offshore oil rigs.

VLADIKAVKAZ, Russia - Rescuers battled to find about 100 people still missing after a weekend glacier-slip in the Caucasus mountains as meltwaters from the fallen ice poured into villages and drove out residents.

COPENHAGEN - South Korean President Kim Dae-jung told Asian and European Union leaders at a summit that reclusive North Korea's recent overtures to its neighbours pointed to the eventual reunification of the Korean peninsula.

BRATISLAVA - Slovak centre-right parties kicked off talks on the makeup of the country's future government after winning weekend elections that are seen securing the country's entry into the EU and NATO.

TEHRAN - Iran said it had accepted London's nomination of a new British ambassador, ending a seven-month diplomatic dispute following Tehran's rejection of Britain's former candidate for the job earlier this year.
GULU, Uganda - Army officials said that Uganda's withdrawal from the Democratic Republic of Congo, dogged by logistical problems and delays, was due to be completed within a week.

MADRID - A row between Spain and Morocco over a deserted Mediterranean islet flared up again after Rabat cancelled talks at the last minute, alleging Madrid had landed a military helicopter on the disputed island.
